00016 #pragma mark Hub Bindings

00018 // Registering with the jcom.hub object
00019 t_object *jcom_core_subscribe(t_object *x, t_symbol *name, t_object *container, t_symbol *object_type)
00020 {
00021         if(max5){
00022                 return NULL;
00023         }
00024         else{
00025                 t_patcher       *p = (t_patcher*)container;
00026                 t_box           *b;
00027                 t_class         *theclass;
00028                 t_object        *hub = NULL;
00029                 
00030         again:  
00031                 for(b = p->p_box; b; b = b->b_next){                                                    // traverse the linked list of boxes in the patch
00032                         if(b->b_firstin && ((t_object*)(b->b_firstin))->o_magic != 1758379419){
00033                                 error("jamoma_core_subscribe: something has gone terribly wrong");
00034                                 post("maybe you have multiple modules with the same OSC name?");
00035                                 return NULL;
00036                         }
00037                         theclass = object_class(b->b_firstin);
00038                         if(object_classname_compare(b->b_firstin, ps_jcom_hub)){        // if this is a jcom.hub...
00039                                 object_method(b->b_firstin, ps_subscribe, name, x, object_type);
00040                                 hub = (t_object*)b->b_firstin;                                                  // store the pointer
00041                                 break;                                                                                                  // then stop looking
00042                         }
00043                 }
00044                 if(hub == NULL){                                                        // failed to find a hub in the patch...
00045                         if(p->p_vnewobj != NULL){                               //      go one level higher and search there
00046                                 b = (t_box *)p->p_vnewobj;
00047                                 p = b->b_patcher;
00048                                 goto again;
00049                         }
00050                         else
00051                                 error("object named '%s' could not find a jcom.hub for subscribing", name->s_name);
00052                 }
00053                 return hub;
00054         }
00055 }
00056 
00057 // Unregister from the jcom.hub object
00058 //void jcom_core_unsubscribe(void *hub, t_symbol *name)
00059 void jcom_core_unsubscribe(t_object *hub, void *object)
00060 {
00061         if(hub)
00062                 object_method(hub, ps_unsubscribe, object);
00063 }

00069 // Copying all of the elements should be faster than branching and copying one element
00070 //      (that's the theory anyway...)
00071 void jcom_core_atom_copy(t_atom *dst, t_atom *src)
00072 {
00073         //      memcpy(dst, src, sizeof(t_atom));
00074         sysmem_copyptr(src, dst, sizeof(t_atom));
00075 }

00078 bool jcom_core_atom_compare(t_symbol *type, t_atom *a1, t_atom *a2)
00079 {
00080         if(!a1 || !a2)
00081                 return 0;
00082                 
00083         if(type == ps_msg_float){                               // float is first so that it gets process the most quickly
00084                 if(atom_getfloat(a1) == atom_getfloat(a2))
00085                         return 1;
00086         }
00087         else if((type == ps_msg_int) || (type == ps_msg_toggle)){
00088                 if(atom_getlong(a1) == atom_getlong(a2))
00089                         return 1;
00090         }
00091         else if(type == ps_msg_symbol){
00092                 if(atom_getsym(a1) == atom_getsym(a2))
00093                         return 1;
00094         }
00095         else if((type == ps_msg_generic) || (type == ps_msg_list)){
00096                 // type msg_list should be checked here as well.  If type == msg_list and this function is called
00097                 // it means we are dealing with a list of length 1, so we only need to compare one atom anyway.
00098                 
00099                 // note that if the two are of different types, then they are obviously not the same
00100                 if((a1->a_type == A_LONG) && (a2->a_type == A_LONG)){
00101                         if(a1->a_w.w_long == a2->a_w.w_long)
00102                                 return 1;
00103                 }
00104                 else if((a1->a_type == A_FLOAT) && (a2->a_type == A_FLOAT)){
00105                         if(a1->a_w.w_float == a2->a_w.w_float)
00106                                 return 1;
00107                 }
00108                 else if((a1->a_type == A_SYM) && (a2->a_type == A_SYM)){
00109                         if(a1->a_w.w_sym == a2->a_w.w_sym)
00110                                 return 1;
00111                 }
00112         }
00113         else
00114                 error("atom_compare: cannot do comparison on this data type");
00115         return 0;
00116 }

00119 void jcom_core_file_writeline(t_filehandle *fh, long *the_eof, char *the_text)
00120 {
00121         char    tempstring[4096];
00122         short   err = 0;
00123         long    len = 0;
00124         
00125         strcpy(tempstring, the_text);
00126         strcat(tempstring, "\n");
00127         len = strlen(tempstring);
00128         err = sysfile_write(*fh, &len, &tempstring);
00129         if(err){
00130                 error("jamoma: sysfile_write error (%d)", err);
00131                 return;
00132         }
00133         *the_eof = *the_eof + len;
00134 }

00137 // Compare Strings: Is s2 after s1 in alphabetical order?
00138 bool jcom_core_string_compare(char *s1, char *s2)
00139 {
00140         short i;
00141         short len1 = strlen(s1);
00142         short len2 = strlen(s2);
00143         bool result = false;
00144         bool keepgoing = true;
00145         
00146         if(len2 < len1)
00147                 len1 = len2;    // only compare the characters of the short string
00148                 
00149         for(i=0; i<len1 && keepgoing; i++){
00150                 if(s1[i] < s2[i]){
00151                         result = true;
00152                         keepgoing = false;
00153                 }
00154                 else if(s1[i] > s2[i])
00155                         keepgoing = false;
00156         }
00157         return result;
00158 }

00161 // Load an external for internal use
00162 // returns true if successful
00163 bool jcom_core_loadextern(t_symbol *objectname, long argc, t_atom *argv, t_object **object)
00164 {
00165         t_class         *c = NULL;
00166         t_object        *p = NULL;
00167 
00168         c = class_findbyname(ps_box, objectname);
00169         if(!c){
00170                 p = (t_object *)newinstance(objectname, 0, NULL);
00171                 if(p){
00172                         c = class_findbyname(ps_box, objectname);
00173                         freeobject(p);
00174                         p = NULL;
00175                 }
00176                 else{
00177                         error("jamoma: could not load extern (%s) within the core", objectname->s_name);
00178                         return false;
00179                 }
00180         }
00181 
00182         if(*object != NULL){                    // if there was an object set previously, free it first...
00183                 object_free(*object);
00184                 *object = NULL;
00185         }
00186 
00187         *object = (t_object *)object_new_typed(CLASS_BOX, objectname, argc, argv);
00188         return true;
00189 }

00192 // Function the translates a Max path+filename combo into a correct absolutepath
00193 // TODO: remove this function once we've completed the transition to Max5, as path_topathname() is fixed for Max5
00194 void jcom_core_getfilepath(short in_path, char *in_filename, char *out_filepath)
00195 {
00196         char    path[4096];
00197         
00198         path_topathname(in_path, in_filename, path);
00199 
00200 #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00201         char *temppath;
00202         temppath = strchr(path, ':');
00203         *temppath = '\0';
00204         temppath += 1;
00205 
00206         // at this point temppath points to the path after the volume, and out_filepath points to the volume
00207         sprintf(out_filepath, "/Volumes/%s%s", path, temppath);
00208 #else // WIN_VERSION
00209         strcpy(out_filepath, path);
00210 #endif
00211 }

00214 // Add attributes that are common to many subscribers (such as parameter, message, and return)
00215 void jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_common(t_class *c, t_object *attr, long offset, bool define_name)
00216 {
00217         long            attroffset;
00218 
00219         // METHODS
00220         class_addmethod(c, (method)jcom_core_subscriber_hubrelease,     "release",              A_CANT, 0);     // notification of hub being freed
00221         class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,                         "dumpout",              A_CANT, 0);  
00222         class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,                        "quickref",             A_CANT, 0);
00223 
00224         // ATTRIBUTE: name
00225         if(define_name){
00226                 attroffset = offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common, attr_name);
00227                 jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "name", _sym_symbol,
00228                         (method)jcom_core_subscriber_attribute_common_setname, (method)jcom_core_attr_getname,
00229                         attroffset);
00230         }
00231 }
00232 
00233 
00234 void jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_extended(t_class *c, t_object *attr, long offset, bool define_name)
00235 {
00236         long            attroffset;
00237 
00238         jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_common(c, attr, offset, define_name);
00239 
00240         // ATTRIBUTE: range <low, high>
00241         attroffset = offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended, attr_range);
00242         jamoma_class_attr_array_new(c, "range", _sym_float32, 2,
00243                 (method)jcom_core_attr_setrange, (method)jcom_core_attr_getrange,
00244                 offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended, attr_range_len), attroffset);
00245 
00246         // ATTRIBUTE: repetitions - 0 means repetitive values are not allowed, 1 means they are
00247         attroffset = offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended, attr_repetitions);
00248         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "repetitions", _sym_long,
00249                 (method)0, (method)jcom_core_attr_getrepetitions,
00250                 attroffset);
00251 
00252         // ATTRIBUTE: type 
00253         // this is not defined here because some objects (i.e jcom.parameter) need to treat this in different ways
00254         
00255         // ATTRIBUTE: clipmode - options are none, low, high, both
00256         attroffset = offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended, attr_clipmode);
00257         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "clipmode", _sym_symbol,
00258                 (method)0, (method)jcom_core_attr_getclipmode,
00259                 attroffset);
00260 
00261         // ATTRIBUTE: description - does nothing, but is accessed by jcom.dispatcher for /autodoc generation
00262         attroffset = offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended, attr_description);
00263         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "description", _sym_symbol,
00264                 (method)0, (method)jcom_core_attr_getdescription,
00265                 attroffset);
00266 }

00269 // arg is subscriber name
00270 void jcom_core_subscriber_new_common(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *x, t_symbol *name, t_symbol *subscriber_type)
00271 {
00272         t_atom  a;
00273         
00274         x->subscriber_type = subscriber_type;
00275         x->custom_subscribe = NULL;
00276         x->hub = NULL;
00277         x->obj_hub_broadcast = NULL;
00278         x->module_name = _sym_nothing;
00279 
00280         // we call the function directly here rather than use object_attr_setvalueof() 
00281         // because parameters with pattr bindings don't actually have their own 'name' attribute
00282         atom_setsym(&a, name);
00283         jcom_core_subscriber_attribute_common_setname(x, NULL, 1, &a);
00284         
00285         x->container = jamoma_object_getpatcher((t_object*)x);
00286         
00287         // set up the jcom.receive the listens to broadcast messages from the hub
00288         atom_setsym(&a, ps_jcom_broadcast_fromHub);
00289         if(!jcom_core_loadextern(ps_jcom_receive, 1, &a, &x->obj_hub_broadcast))
00290                 error("jcom.core: loading jcom.receive extern failed");
00291         else
00292                 object_method(x->obj_hub_broadcast, ps_setcallback, &jcom_core_broadcast_callback, x);
00293         
00294 }

00297 void jcom_core_subscriber_new_extended(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended *x, t_symbol *name, t_symbol *subscriber_type)
00298 {
00299         jcom_core_subscriber_new_common((t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *)x, name, subscriber_type);
00300         
00301         x->attr_range[0] = 0.0;
00302         x->attr_range[1] = 1.0;
00303         x->attr_clipmode = ps_none;
00304         x->attr_description = _sym_nothing;
00305         x->attr_type = ps_msg_generic;
00306         x->attr_repetitions = 1;
00307 }

00310 // function for registering with the jcom.hub object
00311 void jcom_core_subscriber_subscribe(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *x)
00312 {
00313         if(x->hub == NULL){                     // do not allow multiple subscribes of this object 
00314                 x->hub = jcom_core_subscribe((t_object*)x, x->attr_name, x->container, x->subscriber_type);
00315                 if(x->hub) 
00316                         x->module_name = (t_symbol *)object_method(x->hub, ps_core_module_name_get);
00317                 if(x->custom_subscribe)
00318                         x->custom_subscribe(x);
00319         }
00320 }
00321 
00322 
00323 // Notification that the hub no longer exists
00324 void jcom_core_subscriber_hubrelease(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *x)
00325 {
00326         x->hub = NULL;
00327 }

00330 // Set a custom subscribe method
00331 void jcom_core_subscriber_setcustomsubscribe_method(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *x, t_subscribe_method meth)
00332 {
00333         x->custom_subscribe = meth;
00334 }

00337 // Unsubscribe and common freeing code
00338 void jcom_core_subscriber_common_free(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *x)
00339 {
00340         jcom_core_unsubscribe(x->hub, x);
00341         x->hub = NULL;
00342         object_free(x->obj_hub_broadcast);
00343         x->obj_hub_broadcast = NULL;
00344 }

00347 // receive messages from our internal jcom.receive external
00348 void jcom_core_broadcast_callback(void *z, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00349 {
00350         t_jcom_core_subscriber_common   *x = (t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *)z;
00351         
00352         if(msg == gensym("hub.changed"))
00353                 defer_low(x, (method)jcom_core_subscriber_subscribe, 0, 0, 0);
00354 }

00357 // COMMON ATTRIBUTE: name
00358 t_max_err jcom_core_subscriber_attribute_common_setname(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00359 {       
00360         t_symbol *arg = atom_getsym(argv);
00361         x->attr_name = arg;
00362 
00363         if(arg->s_name[strlen(arg->s_name)-1] == '*')
00364                 x->has_wildcard = true;
00365         else
00366                 x->has_wildcard = false;
00367 
00368         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00369 }
00370 
00371 t_max_err jcom_core_attr_getname(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended *x, void *attr, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00372 {
00373         *argc = 1;
00374         if (!(*argv)) // otherwise use memory passed in
00375                 *argv = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom));
00376         atom_setsym(*argv, x->attr_name);
00377 
00378 //      jamoma_class_attr_get_sender((t_object*)x, attr, *argc, *argv);
00379         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00380 }
00381 
00382 
00383 // We are using a custom setter here because relying on the offset seemed to cause memory corruption
00384 // This was the easiest way to avoid that.
00385 t_max_err jcom_core_attr_setrange(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00386 {       
00387         if(argc)
00388                 x->attr_range[0] = atom_getfloat(argv+0);
00389         if(argc > 1)
00390                 x->attr_range[1] = atom_getfloat(argv+1);
00391         
00392         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00393 }
00394 
00395 t_max_err jcom_core_attr_getrange(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended *x, void *attr, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00396 {
00397         *argc = 2;
00398         // FIXME: This checks if we have memory passed in, good, but how do we know if it is enough memory for 2 atoms? [TAP]
00399         if (!(*argv)) // otherwise use memory passed in
00400                 *argv = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom) * 2);
00401         //sysmem_copyptr(x->atom_list, *argv, sizeof(t_atom) * 2);
00402         atom_setfloat(*argv, x->attr_range[0]);
00403         atom_setfloat(*argv+1, x->attr_range[1]);
00404 
00405 //      jamoma_class_attr_get_sender((t_object*)x, attr, *argc, *argv);
00406         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00407 }

00413         if (!(*argv)) // otherwise use memory passed in

00415         atom_setlong(*argv, x->attr_repetitions);
00416 
00417 //      jamoma_class_attr_get_sender((t_object*)x, attr, *argc, *argv);
00418         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00419 }
